lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Hello everyone, and welcome to tonight's episode of Critical Role, where a bunch of us nerdy-ass voice actors sit around and play Dungeons & Dragons. And Sam makes noise from his phone over there. Strangely.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I can't turn it off! It won't stop!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: More information will be made available as the parents see fit. I'm glad that I worked towards a narrative exit for them that they couldn't be there for. So anyway--

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: We love you, Travis and Laura!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Super excited. We love you guys so much, seriously.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: We love you!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You're amazing, and we look forward to meeting the new one very soon.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I love that you can't emote.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I can't smile.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Just saying, they could've held the baby five more hours. I feel like they could've done it.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: I'm just saying, then we could've shared a birthday.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: It is the best day! So much is going on. My nephew is here, so many things are happening behind the scenes. It is the best day!

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: It's crazy.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: We're so tired and it's great.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: So anyway, let's get through our announcements real fast. First and foremost, a big thank you to our returning fantastic sponsors of this campaign, D&D Beyond! Sam, if you don't mind.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: And just for my little extra here tonight, not getting lost in the fact that Travis and Laura are having the most magical day of their lives and Liam is gone, I wanted to pay special tribute to our little Ashley who's leaving us for a while. I feel like she should get some love too on her way out the door. I composed a song for you in the style of your favorite band, Boyz II Men.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Ah, yes!

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: How did you know?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: (singing) How do I say goodbye... shit. To our sweet, innocent harbinger of death fallen angel? On NBC you play a geek, but you're a real one here with us every week. If we get to visit Xhorhas, I hope Blindspot will let you play. But until then, I hope Patterson dies every day!

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Yay!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Thank you, Sam.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: That's hard to do in a mustache.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: I can see the--

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Are you committing to this all night?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: This is what I did the first time through the campaign, so that's what I gotta do this time!

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Holy shit. I thought this was for your opening gag.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Me too!

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: This is what I wore this time in the first campaign.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I remember!

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: So on this show where Ashley is about to leave, baby Baileyham has just been born, I'm in the woods, and we're about to move, you decided to wear that for the entire episode?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I did not decide. This was put upon me by the fates.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: You made that, though!

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Yeah. I can't un-make it.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yep, it is a thing. Congratulations.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: It's been a while, is the monkey Smokey or the Bandit? I can never remember.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Oh, the monkey’s here, right? Okay, good.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: As long as that is on your face, you will get no sugar from me, Sam Riegel.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: But we'll be back the week after that, the second week of July we'll be picking up with the Talks Machina of tonight's episode, then hosted by our fantastic Brian W. Foster. Then the following Thursday, the following episode, in which we will have a guest, maybe two, joining us.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Oh, what? Okay. Will one of them be a baby?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: I think language is an important barrier in teaching D&D.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: You're pretty good, though.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Anyway, just so you guys are aware. Also, for those who haven't seen on social media, welcome, we just launched a Kickstarter with our good friends at Steamforged Games.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Holy shit, that's right, that's also going on! Every day feels like a year.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: There are Kickstarter exclusive rewards that include Pumat Prime for The Mighty Nein, and his three simulacrum! As well as a fantastic Taryon Darrington and Doty for the Vox Machina side. Go ahead and check it out, it's going to be up there for another week or so, I believe. If you can't afford it right now, you can even put a dollar in there and we'll have opportunities down the road hopefully for you to jump in if you missed it the first round. But when it comes down to it, you get eight minis for Vox Machina, you get the Mighty Nein minis as well, another eight minis, with Shakäste involved in there. All the Pumats as well, and the extra bonus features of Tary and Doty, all for $60. Which is a pretty fantastic package for the quality of these and for the collectable aspect of it. If you like it, help make it happen more! It's already exploded, it's nuts.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: The boxes are looking so cool.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: I haven't seen the boxes yet.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I probably shouldn't spoil that, but it's pretty cool.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: I should see that. We're super excited about it. You guys have already blown it out of the water. If you haven't had the opportunity, now's the time to jump in and I hope you enjoy them. So I believe that's all the rest of the announcements we have.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I'm so emotional.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: And welcome back.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: That was a good one.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You, after having this conversation with them, retrieving your money, and leaving Kiri with them for the time being for safekeeping, decided to see if you had the possibility to prevent them from being sent to an Empire-run orphanage, in the hopes of freeing their parents in some way, shape or form from their binds. That was where we had left off.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Where are we now? Are we still in the butcher?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You guys have stepped out of the butcher home, leaving the kids behind with Kiri, and you are now out in the open streets of Hupperdook, late morning, midday. What would you like to do?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Is Rissa still there?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Rissa is still with you.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Rissa? Sorry. Okay.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: You said late morning? Midday? So we could at least go check out this prison and do some scouting before nightfall, yeah?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: We were talking about planning, and then sleeping, and then going.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: If we see those teenagers also, we should probably call them off.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Oh, the teenagers.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I really would hate for our problem with them to end up coming and finding the kids. My words aren't really here right now, you know what I mean.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Yeah, you just had a baby, I understand.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Emotionally.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Do we want to leave it up to chance that we'll run into those two kids, that they will not succeed, or we'll find them?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: At the very least, we can leave word with their employer and if we run into them, we'll call them off.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I say we send Rissa to go talk to them.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Rissa knows the town, though, she might be able to help us scout out this prison.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: That's true. Maybe we go back to their employer?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: We'll have Rissa meet us at the prison maybe later. She can call them off and we can head to the prison.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Why don't we have Fjord and Jester go tell their employers!

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: "Great. Yep"

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Which one are you? Are you Jester?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I don't know anymore. Who wants the node, by the way?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Oh, yes. Well, let's find out if we need it yet.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Yeah, let's hold on to it. Maybe there's going to be some sort of emergency situation.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Fair.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Use node in case of emergency.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Jester, could we perhaps hold on to your backpack before you go so that we have that in case we need it?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "No! I am going to hold onto this. Why would I give it to you?"

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Well, I feel it is fairly obvious, but okay, as you were.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "I'm not going anywhere, why would I give it to you? This is my bag, I paid for it."

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Ja. Okay, so what are we doing now?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I guess we're all going.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: This is revenge for any time we haven't let Matt go on an NPC, just saying.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Let's go take a look at this prison.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: All right.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Rissa goes, "All right, I can go ahead and lead you to it. Can't say I've been too close to "it, personally, so far. Follow me." Rissa guides you through the rest of the shelf back to the walkway that winds down the front of the mountain to the bottom half of the city of Hupperdook.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Lowerdook.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Lowerdook, if you will.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Wait, are Fjord and Jester going to go call off the employers?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: They're with you guys. You can go head that way if you want to call them off, unless you want to send them on their own wild goose chase.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Fuck those guys. They'll be fine.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I would just hate for them to find the kids and then do something to the kids.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: How would they find the kids?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: They're literally on a mission to find the kids right now.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Hmm.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I mean, we put Caleb's Alarm across it, but still.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: We did.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Still, if they get across.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Exactly. I don't know.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "I could maybe send them a message?"

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Oh, yes. You have that spell, don't you?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "I do!"

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Can you do it to the kids?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: To Fitz and Ashton.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Yeah.

lines.name: TALIESIN, MARISHA
lines.text: Let's do that.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: To Fitz.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Okay."

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Man, that solves that problem.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: She quietly tugs on the symbol of the Traveler and goes like, "Okay, Fitz? This is the "girl with the people that were making you angry--"

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: You have, like, eight words left.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "We... found it so..."

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: We don't need help.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Everything is good!"

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Go back to work.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Go-back-to-work!"

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Technically, "go back to work" can be one word if you say it fast enough.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: That's true. A lot of that was hyphenated.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "The Traveler is very forgiving."

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Grammar.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You've seen it as you approached and there was the large platform elevator that rose up to the second layer. It's currently not being used; it's locked on the upper floor. As you head into that area, the smokestacks are billowing strongly, business is in the process of being done full-throttle in the understanding that this coming conflict or the now arrived conflict on the eastern side has put everyone into overdrive to prepare whatever sort of equipment or weaponry they can send that direction.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: And the stuff they're making is catapults or guns?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Well, from the outside, all you can see, because you haven't been inside any of the warehouses-- There is the Iron Lot and there's the Assembly Yard. The Assembly Yard is the one that's the open space where they're building these large siege engines. You see mobile carts that are either horse-drawn or powered by something you don't quite understand yet that have other large weapons attached to them.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Siege towers. Also Lord of the Rings-style.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Very Lord of the Rings.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Battering ram, like every fantasy movie-style, but definitely Lord of the Rings and the huge cannons.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Not very Lord of the Rings.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Pirates.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Cool.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: That's what we saw last-- or that's what I think I saw when we did a perception check or something.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Mm-hmm.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: And it looks like a big factory that looks like a evil Willy Wonka factory kind of thing.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Uh-huh.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yes. So as you are being led down, Rissa's pointing out some elements of it. She goes, "Okay, "so over that side is the Omnismelter." She points over to a cluster of a dozen or so warehouses that are scattered in a spider web-like formation that are connected by a series of hallways between each other and then towards a central piece. She goes, "That there is where most of the foundries of the "city lie. Where all the various mined ingots or those imported are melted down and utilized. The "foreman there is a bit of a tool. There's the Armavault." She points to the far northern side of the mountain base and you see a 25, 30-foot tall by 60-foot across iron door that is solid and jammed into the side of this mountain. It looks like it's very well protected from this glance at the distance. From what you can see, there's maybe two dozen or so crownsguard that are stationed at its base. "That's where most of the funds that are saved for the uses of the city maintain as well as "a number of the not currently being used devices of war. Means of defending the city should it come "under attack, if you will." Points over there. You can see what looks to be where most of this smoke and steam is rising from. There is this one large, two-story black tower that has a single column of fast moving smoke pouring out of it. You can see areas where the smoke seems to be pulsing or darkening and widening at certain places. She goes, "That there is the Underbellows. That's "where they utilize a number of the forges and furnaces for the factories here. They've harnessed "some of the volcanic activity beneath the mountain and that maintains a consistent heat for the "forges. Smells downright awful, to be honest. Over there's the Firemark Facility." She points over to a building that looks a little simpler. It's not super tall and ominous-looking. It's very plain, made of cheap metals. You notice all the buildings here are mostly metal, probably because there's a lot of dealing with heat, fire, sparks, and the last thing you need is any of these things to catch fire. She points, though, to the Firemark Facility and she goes, "This is where they're "developing a majority of certain explosive and black powder-based technologies."

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: What's that place called again?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "It's called the Firemark Facility."

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Firemark.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Is it heavily protected?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "(chuckles) Most everything is here. Then right over there," and she points to the southern side of the mountain base of the Iron Lot to a smaller doorway. Similar in shape and construction as to the Armavault, but it's a little more localized. Maybe about 15-foot high and about 20-foot wide. "That is the Gearhold Prison. The one you were asking about. The one where my father "done fucked up."

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: What do you know about that machine he built, anyway?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "It's-- have you ever seen an automaton where they're made of stone or made of clay?"

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Come across a couple.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Imagine one that's made of metal and gears and blades. Lots of blades."

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: What? Blades?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Blades."

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Oh, god.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Vampire Hunters. Sorry.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "It is covered in Daywalkers, yes."

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Do the blades spin?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It doesn't have feet."

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: It just rolls and cuts.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Basically."

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Oh my god.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: It is animated by magical means?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Partially magical and partially clockwork."

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Is it steam-powered? Or is it--

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "The power source is magical, but most of its actual locomotion is done through clockwork "and various internal gears. It's actually quite a marvel to behold. It's just--"

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: It's a magical power source, then.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "As far as I know. It's not my mastery. It's my daft father's."

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: So where's the source?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: It's inside of it, I would assume, right?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: So if we get the source--

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Maybe?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: What did your father call this "robit"?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "He referred to it as the Gearkeeper."

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: The Gearkeeper.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "It was designed to be one of the threatening wardens to help quell any sort of "breakouts of the prison. Meant as an intimidation device for those who attempted to rise up against "their captors and possibly be its first initial run to be a defensive sentinel for the city. If "these things worked properly, having five or six of them just rapidly on the outskirts of the city "would probably keep anyone from trying to break in here or make any sort of lawless act in its "boundaries. Unfortunately, they've only made one and it went crazy and killed a bunch of people. So "there's that."

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Yeah. Doesn't sound like a city I'd want to live in.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Yeah, that's why I'm trying to fix it."

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: (sighs)

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: They just let it-- they've cornered it into a--

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "They sealed it off. They've been trying to get back to it, but there's a lot of distraction "and honestly it's out of sight, out of mind, I think."

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Honestly, we could just show up and say we've been hired to try and take care of it and go in.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Would anyone believe that?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: We technically have been hired to go in and take care of it. We're just working in trade.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Not by the city.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: No, they know not by the city, so by a private contractor.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I am sorry, I don't understand. You say they're too busy to deal with it. Have they got it locked away in a vault while it just stomps around?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "As far as I know, yeah. They'd originally had it placed in the bottom floor in one section "which had more of the very violent criminals and killed a bunch of them. Not too bad. Killed a "bunch of guards. That's pretty bad. At the time, they didn't have the manpower to fight it off, so "they sealed the doors and haven't had a problem since."

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: So was anyone else left in there with it? That it maybe didn't kill or--

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "It's been there for quite some time. A couple years at least, I think. Two or three "years? So if anyone was, they've expired, I'm pretty sure. Sorry."

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: That's fine by me.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Hmm.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I think we're going to have to do a little more research, but I'm feeling pretty good about our prospects.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Well, the main concern is getting in the prison. I don't know if walking up to the front door and saying, "Hi, we're here to take care of your spinny death problem," is going to work.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: We heard you have a bug problem. We're here to take care of it?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Do we need outfits or something?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I mean, I suggest we wear shoes and pants, but you know.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: What, like Orkin man outfits, or do we need to look like we're official?

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Like a uniform of some sort?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: We could have a letter from your father, perhaps?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Can we go get suits?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "That's true."

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: But they don't like her father.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Yeah, but they'd be perfectly happy if we-- We're going in knowing full well what we're getting into. There's no harm, no foul there.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Awesome black suits.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: We are a group of people claiming we're here to deal with their issue. We either die doing it or solve the problem.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Heist-type maintenance workers uniforms?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Okay. You really want to break into a prison?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I just want to wear a onesie.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Yeah, yeah.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I feel like we can make that dream come true.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Something with a big lapel. Maybe double breasted. Sounds great. We would look so handsome, you guys.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Jester leans in to Rissa and goes, "Rissa? Do you have any examples of your father's writing "because I can copy it pretty well."

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Ooh. That sounds like something that's way too smart for Laura to say.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Oh.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: You're so lucky she's not watching right now.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: She'll be watching.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: She probably is.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: She's probably watching. Hi, Laura. I would love to see if there's any sort of sketch or blueprint of this thing that we could just take a look at first and maybe have a thought of our plan of attack.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "I can guarantee you they're not going to have any publicly available blueprints of a prison."

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: No, I mean of the machine.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Oh!"

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Would your dad?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "We can certainly ask."

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Just to sort of see what we're getting into.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You see that spark in her eye of a good idea and then thinking about having to go back to her father she's like (sighs).

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: We can go on our own, if you like.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It's okay. Come on."

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Does your dad like pastries? Does he have a sweet tooth?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "I imagine he does. I've seen him eat a few."

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Does he like pies?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Probably."

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Let's pick up your dad a pie on the way home.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Okay."

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: People like pies, right?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I love a pie.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I mean, I like pies but I'm a bad example of so many things.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: I really like meat pies.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Meat pies. Would your dad like a meat pie? I just hear people bring pies.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Fjord kind of leans in and goes, "That's good, Jester."

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Thank you.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: (snickers)

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Beau. But that's okay. It's been a long, emotional day.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Has been.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Hasn't it, Fjord?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It's been a long day.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Why? You playing five characters at the same time?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It's fine.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: This brings me back to some home games.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Thanks, Baby Willingham.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Oh man. So much, it's been the longest day.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It's been the longest day.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: (chuckles)

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: We stop and get a meat pie on the way.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right. Easy enough as you're wandering through the street, following the scents of food that are being cooked in advance of the current lunch hour happening. You hear a few whistles go off in the distance and in that moment, Rissa goes, "We best be hurrying before the rush hits." And you pick up the pace as you start hearing the different steam whistles go off and you watch a lot of the buildings begin to just swarm out with all their workers on their brief lunch break. You manage to stay ahead of most of the wave making their way up to the top shelf of the city, eventually coming to one of the vendors on the outside who is swarmed by about 12 or 13 different gnomes. You wait patiently for about a good 15, 20 minutes or so as they prepare and get all their meat pies ready, sweet pies ready. Sell a few things, a couple of their regulars cut in line in front of you, not paying much attention or caring that you're waiting patiently. But there is a large crowd behind you and you manage to get to the front and the two gnomes that are currently in the process of divvying this up look to the rest of you and go, "Oh, you're a right "interesting team. What brings you here? You looking for pies? We got pies. You want pies?"

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: We'd like a hospitable meat pie.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Single?"

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Oh.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "It's not enough to go around, I can tell you."

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Well, we might need a couple.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: One for us, one for him? Two meat pie-- sorry, three meat pies!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "All right!" Turns around and pulls out three gnome-sized meat pies which are about that big.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Oh.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Can we make that a double?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Six gnomish meat pies!"

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Thank you.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Passes them over.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: We have money again, don't we?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Yes, we have our money back.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I throw down for the pies.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. We'll say for the total of that, it's maybe a silver.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: When the whistles blew, Matthew, did we see any guards do a shift change at the prison?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Because you were rushing to get the pies, make a perception check with disadvantage at this distance.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Mm.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Seven.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Seven. You have no idea.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: That was super smart though.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Yeah, no. That's a good thought.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You have your meat pies. You want to make your way over back to the Tinkertop.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I pass out meat pies to anyone who wants one, but save one.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right. So you have one ready. You guys snack as you walk along. Interesting point of noticing, as you guys come by, you do see a familiar sight for you and for those who've been in the Empire for a bit. You're familiar with this as well, Nott and Caleb.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Oh.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: brain escapes the term. But it's like a short cloak.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Okay.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: These are the tithe collectors.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Oh, yes.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Taxman.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: They're referred to colloquially as Reapers behind their back, but you see them exiting one home and moving onto the next door and knocking.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Are they heading towards the butcher?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: A ways away, but they're present. It seems that the time of year has come, the every-six-month window seems to be coming or has arrived. Nevertheless, you travel with meat pie in hand, eventually making your way back to Tinkertop Inventions, the door still partially ajar. You see the faint light of the two lanterns in the back as you enter, and there in the back you see, in the process of sketching something down, your good friend, Mastermaker Cleff Tinkertop. "Ah, you've returned! "Certainly good to see you! What can I help you with?"

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: We've brought gift.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Oh, that's so kind! Thank you so much!"

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: It was Rissa's idea.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Rissa, for your old pops, did you?" She's like, "Well, it was sort of a group decision. Hope "you like it, Dad." "It's cold, but tasty. Anyway." He takes it and starts eating it, stuffing it in chunks through his gnomish maw, getting bits of the gravy dripping off of the chin.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: We're going to take a stab at this death machine. We were curious if you could--

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I love that that's what we're calling it.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I like the description.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Spinning death machine.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: If there's any information you can give us about the machine, just so that we're not going in cold, like if you know if it has any vulnerabilities to anything.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Plenty! I built the thing myself. Don't worry!"

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: If you can sketch it for us so we can get a sense of--

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Oh, I've already got it. Don't worry there, friend. I'll be right back!" Turns around and disappears behind a--

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: We could steal the crossbow. We don't have to do the mission at all.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Please don't tell me that you're going to do that.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I could, just saying.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You hear some rustling and some things falling over. A couple of banging noises, and then you hear a (clattering), "Damn it."

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Is that a cymbal crashing?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Being as the man's daughter is standing here with us, perhaps we will pass on that idea.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: I'm right next to you, little one."

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: She's clever.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: No, she just has hearing.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: No. She's a wily one.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: A moment later, Cleff returns, clutching an armful of rolled pieces of paper and prints and parchment and goes, "Here's about everything I've got on the thing." Throws it down in front of you, some of it unrolls. There's various stages of design, the breakdown of the mechanics and the interior of this. It's extremely intricate and very impressive clockwork. Roll an intelligence check.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Okay, but I'm not going to be able to make heads or tails of any of this shit.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Yes, I have questions about it as well.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Yeah.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Caleb, you are the one who is the most proficient with understanding systems. If you could make an intelligence check for me as well, both you and Molly, since Molly was the first to grab them.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Oh. Natural one.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Oh no-sies!

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: He's eating that extra meat pie.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Eight.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: One, it's all written in Gnomish. Do either of you guys understand Gnomish as a language?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Does anybody understand Gnomish?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Gnome.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Secondly, a lot of the blueprints are in shorthand, and the design work-- while it's very beautiful to see-- the actual sketching of each stage of its construction and the interior mechanisms about it are very beautiful, it is very intricate. Paying attention to it and looking it over, the best you can ascertain is there is a core. There is some sort of a device that powers it. Through the notes around it, it's supposed to power for about 200 years before it needs replacing.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Just wait it out.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: It's a good half-life.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: It's a Duracell.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: However, around it is layer after layer of metallic iron rings that are joined at certain hinge points so they can spin and shift in the inside like a gyroscope.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: It's very hard to get a spell in there.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yes. It's not impossible if you pull enough of the armor away, which is the next stage, the layers of armor. There's three different layers of articulated armor that can shift and move because on the inside there are about a dozen bladed arms that, at any given point in time, can fold out of the armor and strike like small scythes or sickles and then retract inside.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: You are fucking crazy, Cleff!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "That's certainly not the first time I've heard that!"

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Yeah, so Herr Tinkertop, once we are to get past these defenses, would dispelling its arcane nature shut the machine down?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "I mean, that's possible. Oh, curses! I should've thought of some way of a fail-safe to "prevent that from happening. Well, next design! Next design, it'll be dispel-proof. Thank you for "that! You're a good--"

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: The nutshell protecting that core needs to be defeated first?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "I should've put three."

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: We start pulling plates off--

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: He starts making notes feverishly.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: -- start cutting our way through one specific spot, we could eventually get to a point where you could get some spells in there.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Or maybe Yasha could hit it with her sword.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: You may have to tank this.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: I will certainly try, this does seem like a very--

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Is there a front and back to this thing, or is it just a whirling dervish?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "The front and back is--" Dervish! That's a great pirate word, dervish! He looks to you and goes, "There is, kind of." He goes through one of the papers and pulls it open and there are plates of the armor-- certain plates that fold up from the inside. They open and there is a small lens, like a crystal-type lens, that recesses on the inside when it's moving and then seems to push out from it to see.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Okay.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Question. Can it climb?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Depending on the terrain, probably. If it's flat-walled surfaces, it's not designed for "climbing. It's designed for intimidation and slaughtering. Perhaps my design was a bit "unfocused for the reason they asked me to build it, but, ah! Next time. Climbing? I don't know, "probably not."

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: And does it have any capabilities of attacking at range?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "As far as I know, no, but it moves very fast."

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: These lenses, I'm assuming they're regular lenses? I don't know, they can still be blinded, right?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Maybe. They're made of a very thick crystalline substance that had to be imported from "up north from the remnants of one of the old elven societies there that specialized in making strong "crystal."

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Imported. Great.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: It could possibly be blinded by obscuring the lens?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Maybe."

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I was going to say, if we can get something to blind it, it's still just a lens.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Starts writing down more notes. "Make sure lens can't be obscured in a future design."

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Cleff, when you were building this thing, you were building it off-site I assume, right?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "No, I built it here!"

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: No, I mean off the prison site, not--

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Oh, right."

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: So you don't know any extra secret entrances or exits to the prison itself?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: That would've been very helpful. Sorry."

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Would it be foolish to have you speak on our behalf to usher us in?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "I don't think they're going to let me in."

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Not you in per se, but if we show up as representatives here to dismantle the machine?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Yes, you're finally ready to make amends, et cetera.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: And you hired us to go in and do some work.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Maybe." He looks at Rissa. "Rissa, would you mind bringing your old pops with you?" She's like, "Only to the door, Dad, then you can come back." She glares over the two of you. "If that's "necessary."

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Whatever works.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Fine, come along, then. We'll close up behind, get your keys." "Oh, I haven't been down "for a proper walk with friends in some time, I'm so excited!"

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: We should get some honey or something. I bet some honey on the lens would be a real pain in the ass.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: He takes the last bit of meat pie and shoves it in his mouth real fast.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Do you have any honey?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: (unintelligible shouting)

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I have honey.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Of course you do.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Yeah.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Why not something darker? Like ash, charcoal, black powder.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I have that as well.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: What do you have?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I have molasses.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: That is darker.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Why do you have molasses? This is suddenly very exciting.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I will tell you that in a few minutes, actually, if that's all right.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Jester goes, "This entire time you've been holding out on delicious molasses?"

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: It's industrial grade, it is not for baking.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Are you sure?"

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I am quite sure. Did I stutter?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Is this why your skin is so smooth? You've been giving yourself a facial every night.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Wait, what's the difference between baking and industrial grade?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: That is a good question, Yasha. I don't cook with it, I use it for arcane things.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Magic molasses.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Actually, this brings up a-- how much molasses do you have?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: (as Fjord) "Yeah, how much you carrying?"

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: That's so weird. It’s so abrasive sometimes.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I have about the amount of a plum, wrapped in--

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: That's enough to smear a lens.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I was thinking if we had a small glass jar of it, we could give it a throw.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: We could also put a meat pie in the--

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I could put a meat pie on the end of one of my bolts and shoot it at it.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: (as Fjord) "Pie-chucker."

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I feel like molasses would gum up something that's clockwork, right?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: It could help, it depends on how strong the clockwork is.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Or just tar or something.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Yeah, something sticky.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Bubble gum.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: That would be even better, if we could get our hands on--

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Maybe on the walk, we can see if we can find a tar restaurant.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Rissa goes, "I mean, tar is not uncommonly used in some of the industrial districts down in "the Iron Lot."

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: And we do have some friends over there that we just sent their young interns away on a--

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Well, the forge masters, they're mainly in metalwork. As far as tar use, that's going to be "down in the Iron Lot, and that's going to be-- you're on your own there."

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I mean, how do we transport it?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: In a bucket?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: In a very gentle bucket or pot.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Heated tar? In a bucket?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: It doesn't have to be hot. It just has to be--

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: It has to be a little hot.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Has to be a little hot.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Yeah, it gets hard. It's tar.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Fjord goes, "If only we knew someone around here who is pretty decent with fire."

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Hey, you could heat up a bucket of tar as we walk into a prison. That wouldn't be suspicious at all!

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Once we get down! Once we get down!

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: That is a good idea, Fjord. Also, Fjord, congratulations on this, your most auspicious day.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Why thank you. I appreciate you being so forthright and appreciative, Caleb."

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Yeah. Get your sleep while you can, and don't use the exercise ball to rock him to sleep because then they get addicted to it, and that's the end of your sleep life yourself.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "I have no idea what the hell you're talking about."

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Did you babysit a lot as a kid, Caleb? Is this how you know so much?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Oh, no.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: It's too deep.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You just broke the Prismatic Wall.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: This is getting a little heavy.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: He totally just took a thank you for not his baby being born!

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: This is the worst night ever!

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Can I remove that?

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Please take it off!

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: No! I’m committed!

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I feel like at break time last time, it came off.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Yeah.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: You made it to break, I think.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I've got two spares if I need it!

lines.name: MARISHA, ASHLEY, TALIESIN
lines.text: No!

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Don't do this to yourself.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: At this point, as you guys are having this awkward conversation, Cleff is rushing around grabbing a coat and grabbing some other things, filling the inside of his apron with various tools and utensils, "Oh, I can probably use that. All right, I think I'm ready to come with you."

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Let's go.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: He takes another step and keeps looking around.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: When was the last time you left your house, Cleff?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "It's been a while. It's starting to get a little warm." Rissa is like, "He's kind of a-- "what's the term?"

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Agoraphobic.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Agoraphobic, if you will. He's a bit iffy on the outside. Are you sure you're all right, Dad? You can still stay." "No, no, it's fine. I want to hang out with my friends here. (nervous laugh)"

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Do you need a drink to soothe your nerves?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "I don't-- I've never had a drink. I don't need a drink, but thank you."

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: But it would really help.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Well I--" and looks over.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: How about just a huddle up? Huddle up, let's just--

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Just us?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: No, we can put him in the center.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Huddle around him, okay. We perform a protective--

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You all get really close to him. He's like, "Oh, this is really warm. This is a lot of attention."

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: No, not that close. We're making a safety bubble.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Oh, all right."

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I mean, it could be warm.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: This is silly. I take off the cloak that I've been wearing for a week or so now, and I just put it over the man's head.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: (muffled yelp)

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: No, oh, sorry.

lines.name: SAM, MATT
lines.text: (laughter)

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: To disguise his appearance.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: In a smothering way.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: He takes it and pulls it over his head. "All right," and he, "Let's go (nervous chuckle)." And is like, "One step, two step." He's basically Bill Murray in What About Bob? at this point. He's concentrating on each step he makes going forward. It's slowing you down a little bit, but he's making it forward. Rissa is like, (exasperated groan). You eventually make your way, further and further.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: We're just going to walk up to the guards and say we're here to dismantle the "robit," right?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: We are professional robot dismantlers.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: All right, let's do it. Who's going to be doing the talking?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Well, we're going to stop and pick up some tar on the way there and-- I nominate the human to talk.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Ah, I can't nominate Fjord?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Yeah. Yeah, no, I think Fjord would agree with that.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Do you believe in me, Fjord?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "You know, if I have learned anything it is that you are full of surprises. So by all means."

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: All right, tar first.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Tar first. Where do we go for tar, the Iron Lot?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: That's where they're making the bigger constructs "and having to piece together wood exteriors."

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Is that far from here?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "No, it's on the northern side of the bottom shelf." She leads you guys over to the outskirts, and there is a big fence that wraps around the Assembly Yard, where a lot of these thin standing, skeletal towers of metal are placed against some constructs that are in partial levels of construction. Others are empty and not currently in use. Other ones seem to have been near completion, and they're in the process of preparing and breaking down the various siege engine for transport to the east. Who's keeping an eye out to see if there’s anything that could be used like tar? Who's looking for this?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I'll look for that.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right, make a perception check, please.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 18, not too bad. You take about five minutes or so to case the vicinity, and looking between the gate, you can see, two towers over, there is one partially constructed, wide bolt-thrower cart that only has one that's currently bolted to it. You see that they're taking leather elements and tarring them around the edges to prevent any sort of impacts from splintering the wood that's carrying it. It looks like from there, they go with a leather case and put metal over that and bolt it down. But in the process they do have what looks to be a couple of small pails that have some thick, black, tar-like substance that they're putting around the edges.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: And we're behind a gate? And there's workers everywhere?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: There's probably, within current view of the open portion of this side of the Assembly Yard, about 20 or so workers that are in the middle of focusing on their work at hand. But it's in an open space, with maybe 20 to 30 feet open between each project tower. So, it's pretty open. You'd have to be creative.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: This is at the Assembly Yard?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Correct.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I take my staff out. And I go (vibrating ring) across the gate.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Ah, why would you-- no.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: As you do so, (vibrating ring) across it, Rissa goes, "Ah!" And you look at the nearby tower, maybe 25 or 30 feet ahead to the north of you, one of the gnomes at the top of the tower is currently hammering away at one of the large constructs, siege tower-like structures. Looks over, pulls the goggles up, "Hello?"

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Good money or trade for some supplies!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: (hammering)

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: We could just walk in and pretend to be a worker and just grab a bucket.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I thought we're behind a gate, like locked out.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: We could just sneak in the gate.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Just sneak in?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I have an idea. I could summon Schmidt, and it would be a slow process, but he could carry it a couple of inches, low to the ground, and wait, and then go a couple of feet.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: What's his range?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Oh, let's see.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: How far is it, Matt?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: The nearest-- the one little part of the yard that they're currently using this material is about 60 feet away from you. 60 to 70 from your immediate guess at a glance.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Oh, it is about that distance.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: So it might be just shy or-- let's give it a whirl. Just give me ten-ish minutes.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Ten minutes!? Oh, okay.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: That's not bad. I pull a book out of my holster and flip to the right page and start muttering. Does anyone want to do anything in those nine minutes left?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I'll walk around and see if there's a way through the gate that's hidden.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Make an investigation check.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I'll keep an eye on the guard-- not on the guard, I'll keep an eye on the worker.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Ten.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Ten. You take the ten minutes to look through, but this part of the gate is pretty solidly locked in. It's about six and a half, seven feet tall, and it's just metal bars with almost a cross-lattice of even thinner metal strips that are about a quarter-inch thick. The openings are about that big, so you can still see through like portholes, but it's not quite large enough for most of you to slip through. You might be able to if you're careful and squeeze, since you're small enough.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: And they’re mainly gnomes working this--

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Gnomes, and you see a handful of dwarves, but the dwarves seem to be mostly doing oversight, supervision.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Okay. So I like, as a plan B, you disguising yourself as a gnome worker.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Okay, let's see if Schmidt can--

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Do it first?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: So you complete your spell ritual. You summon your Unseen Servant.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Ja. Schmidt, one second. You two, circus people. Mollymauk.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Yeah, yeah.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Could-- ah, that's cute. Could the two of you do something fabulous over there?

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Make a distraction?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Ja.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Juggle something?

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Yeah, I could have you stand on my shoulders.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: We could do that thing. Do you remember the vaulty thing? Let's do the vaulting thing. All right, you're going to do the thing over the-- vault up.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Okay. Ready?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: At which point, Cleff goes, "Oh! We're going to see a performance."

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Yeah. Get ready--

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I preemptively send Schmidt over to the closest bucket.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: And the range on that is-- It cannot get more than 60 feet than you, right?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Ja, that is correct.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. So, what are the two of you doing?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: If you get near the fence, I'm going to try and jump on top of the fence.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Great.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: All right, we're going to need the (mumbling).

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Wait, you're going to jump the fence? No, this is a distraction. You're not supposed to jump in the--

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I'm going to jump on top of the fence.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Oh god.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Are you going to go in or are you just going--

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: No, I'm just going to do the (mumbling).

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Razzle dazzle?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Yeah, like the razzle dazzle.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right. So--

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Here's a question. I'm sorry. How wide apart-- is it bars, the fence? What kind of fence do we have?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: There are large metal poles incrementally, about every 12 or so feet. In between there it looks like there are cross lattices of an inch wide and a quarter-inch thick metal bars that weave across to form the fence.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: So that bucket is not going between any of that.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Probably not.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Nott, would you be able to use your invisible hand to lift that up and over?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: When Schmidt comes close enough, yes.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Okay.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right. You guys are prepared?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Yep.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: I would like you to make an acrobatics check with advantage because you're being aided by Yasha.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I'll keep watch.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Oof, ten.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Land legs open, you manage to miss the vital areas, but it definitely wracks the inside of the thigh a little bit, a painful landing.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Can I try and push up into a handstand?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You manage to do so, but it lacks the presentational and grace element of it. Make a performance check, but with disadvantage from the impact.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: So when he crashes, right at that moment, I ask Schmidt to move the bucket three feet closer to us. Low to the ground.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: All right.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Can I aid him-- okay.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 15, okay. Still pretty good. So in spite of the (strained) impact, you slowly stagger back up to the top, balance yourself.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Up and flipping back up, and I'm going get the swords out. I'm going to start slowly working on moving down the fence, with both swords doing a spin and trying to actually get a little flip going. A little acrobatic--

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Oh boy, another ten feet towards me.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I'll need you spotting, 'cause I'm not great at this.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right, you're turning it around. It's starting to work into your advantage. As this is happening, Schmidt is slowly dragging, on its own, the Unseen Servant is dragging this bucket three feet at a time (scraping).

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I'm keeping watch for any workers who might be noticing the bucket.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: None seem to be noticing the bucket at the moment, but you do see about three or four that are looking over at this very colorful, flashy, performing, nearly wracked tiefling who is in the process of juggling swords in the air and doing a series of completely spontaneous performance art for no reason.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Bravo. Bravo!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You see two of the nearby workers start looking over confused, start talking to each other. You can hear the muttering. One of them runs off to one of the supervisor dwarves who's about 80 to 100 feet off to go tell him what's happening. He looks over and eventually you hear, as Schmidt is getting closer and closer, the bucket of tar is maybe 20 feet from the fence-line, and you hear a voice go, "Hey! Hey! What are you doing!? Get down from there! Get-- go "on, get, get, get!"

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I'm going to jump onto your shoulders now. So, I take a jump and try and land on the shoulders. Straight acrobatics?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Straight acrobatics for this.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: That's a natural 20.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Ooh.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: (flipping) (impact) Landing right onto Yasha's shoulders. She catches you there, and you're still, from their perspective you jumped off of the fence and landed behind the fence, and are--

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: I'm going to do a little side by side walking to make it look like he's--

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Sorry, you had a great fence, and we're working on an act!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Make a deception check.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: It's true.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Nott, how close does Mage Hand have to be?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: It could go now, but we can't go fast, they'll see a moving bucket.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Yeah, we don't want it off the ground.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: That's nine.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Cleff Tinkertop, we're all right. They're with "me." The dwarf comes to a slow jog, to a stop, and goes, "Cleff, what the fuck are you doing down "here?" Schmidt drags the bucket about 15 feet off to the side, and it is near the base of the fence.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Okay, I'll cast Mage Hand.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Are people looking right now?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yes, they are looking.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Okay.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It's about 15-20 feet to the left, but they're currently focused on your group, which is gathered at the edge of the yard where they assemble all of their very powerful military weapons.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: We should be at separate ends of the fence right now, because I made my way down the fence with Yasha.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: So are you attempting to--

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I'm just going to wait until they finish their conversation.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I'd like to get it near the fence, if I can.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It's actually right now, with that final scoot from Schmidt, it's right up against the fence on the opposite side.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Okay, then I'm just going to wait for the right moment. Then I'll have Schmidt lift it over his head, but not yet.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. At this point, the dwarf rushes up to the edge and peers through and goes, "So, strange "arrivals you got here, Cleff, and a couple of loonies diving off the outside of our very "well-protected fence, but sure. Cleff, what's your business with these assholes?" He's like, "We're "making our way to try and make right some mistakes I've made, certainly, hopefully." He glances through with a bit of a tightened gaze and goes, "All right. Well, just keep them off my fence."

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: A lovely fence it is.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Turns around and starts walking back to his post.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: As he starts walking, I'll nod to Caleb and try to do the lift over the fence.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Oh, jeez, I go--

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Make a sleight of hand check to see if you can make the right timing and do so swift enough to where nobody seems to notice.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Sleight of hand? 22.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: With that, as soon as the dwarf turns around and all the rest of the workers go right back simultaneously, seeing that this encounter is over, turn back to their work. (whooshing) Without a sound, rises over the fence and is now at your disposal on the opposite end.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Yeah!

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Hopefully that will do something.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: We have a bucket of tar! Part one of our plan is complete.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: That's how you do it. You set them up, and knock them down.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Look at that teamwork.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: It was pretty good.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Yeah, everybody contributed a little. Except for Jester and Fjord, everyone was really good.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: When do they ever contribute, really?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: (laughter) Rissa goes, "All right, that's the first part of it. What's next?"

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: I guess we head to the prison.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: To the prison!

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Let's put the tar bucket in the haversack of holding, if that's possible. If it will fit.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Will it tip over in the bag?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: She takes it and slowly puts it inside. It will fit in the larger one, so it slips inside the bag. She closes it. "Okay. Are you sure it won't turn over?"

lines.name: MARISHA, TALIESIN
lines.text: No.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I don't know.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "I don't want to ruin my bag."

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Then we don't have to put it in. We'll just carry it.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "I paid good money for it, and it's so pretty."

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: We'll carry it.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Then we're carrying a bucket of tar. Is that weird?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: We're going in to kill a robot. It's fine.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: All right. We'll just carry it.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: What else do you bring into a -- What do they think we're going to do with a bucket of tar?

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: I'll take it.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Carefully hands it to Yasha.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Let's lean into it.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Yeah.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: There, on the outside of this doorway, there's about a dozen crownsguard, mostly gnomish, two human. It looks like they're both currently decorated with a bit more detail, probably sent from the capital, or at least are given a little more of import to the outside of this guarding post. As you approach, you can see these large metal doors. There are two of them, and they open in the center, and there are a set of smaller doors built in the base of each of the sides. As you approach, some of the crownsguard look over curiously at this interesting, wayward group making their way towards the outside. Three of them begin to approach, and one of the humans in the more intricate crownsguard uniform approaches, throwing the cloak over his shoulder, and you can see his hand resting on the handle of his now-sheathed sword. "Hey, who goes there? What is your business?"

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: We are a contracted group of workers, working for this man right here, Cleff. We're here to take care of the problem that we heard you guys had with the clockwork warden.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Cleff pulls the hood back a bit and goes, "Hello." Guy takes a moment and looks. Make a persuasion check with advantage, because Cleff is helping you.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Yeah. Persuasive Beau.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I'll take the 12, for 13.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "All right. Hold tight a second, I'm going to "summon the warden. Just a moment." He steps to one of the small doors that opens, and he disappears inside.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: How many doors are there?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: There's the two large main doors, about 15 feet tall, about 20 foot wide, and then there's smaller doors, normal person-sized, almost gnomish-sized, doors built into it from that point. You actually watch as the human crownsguard has to duck a little bit to go through the smaller door frame. He's gone for about five minutes or so, and then returns and says, "The Wardenhelm "would wish to speak to you, if you wouldn't mind stepping inside. Don't mind the escort; it's "common business."

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: What did you say the warden's name was?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It's Wardenhelm Poppin Drokrusher.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Wardenhelm Poppin--

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Poppin Drokrusher.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Drokrusher.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I'm not going to speak.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: He's like, "Gnomish names."

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I feel that.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: At that point, you guys are led inside the dark interior. As soon as you step into the shadow of the entryway of this prison, you go from the industrial and somewhat colorless Iron Lot that you've been traveling through to this very low-lit, reddish, almost oxidized iron interior that is just shadow and torches. You can see these large support beams of metal put against the rock and stone that has been carved out of the interior of the mountain. It's just one long hallway that splinters off into a number of hallways to the right and left before it reaches the outside of your current visual range to make any more detail out of it. At this point, as you enter, about five more of the crownsguard follow behind you and keep you all as a small pack traveling. At this point, he begins to move forward and gestures for you all to follow, saying, "This way." Leads you down the hall, scooting to the right and heads to the right at the very first branching hallway of the interior of the prison. Heading further down, there's a few doors that are open, and on the inside they appear to be empty, or there's a few other guards. On the interior, you don't see much in the way of crownsguard, you see a different type of guard. Similar garb, but more drab, and you get the sense that they're-- this is an internal prison guard, this isn't part of the paid, trained, citywide guard. These are the interior Hupperdook prison guards. No more than maybe another 40 or so feet down, there's a doorway that's open that leads into an office. On the inside of this office, which itself is also super darkly lit, you see two ember torches that give this very dull red glow on the inside of the room, so it has this somewhat ominous and dreary interior presence to it as you step into this chamber. The desk is facing away from you, and there you see an older and grizzled gnome, who is in the process of wearing these series of robes and cloak over him with these gold-colored tassels and epaulets that shoot off the sides, seems to be giving out an air of station and importance, even though it's just in the process of filing what looks to be either prison transfers or people that have been arrested and figuring out who's to be put in here and why, or whose business is going to come to an end soon. He's in the process of shuffling through papers before turning around to you and goes, "All right, so, you have come to my "prison." Stands up and turns around to you, clicking his feet together as he does so at attention, arms crossed. "Hello. I'm the Wardenhelm Poppin. You have bothered me from my "work, and I would like to know why." As you look at him, you can see his hair has receded almost entirely to the back, and what bits of clustered gray hair on the sides he’s currently attempted to slick and comb back, and one large part of it is trying to cover the massive bald spot, but as he spins around and talks to you, with any sort of movement it wobbles and has to settle itself back into place.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Beau--

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: First off--

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I tap Beau on the back and make her bow a little bit.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: You don't have to-- okay.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Respectful. I appreciate that."

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Pull her back up.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Rissa has backed away to the doorway and is like-- and doesn't want any part in this.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Yeah. Same, Rissa, same. We will not take up much of your time if you just let us in to go kill this clockwork warden that this guy made. We heard he was quite a problem. Just let us in; we'll be out of your hair, and you can get back to your work.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "What?"

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Remember this guy?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: He leans forward, and as the cloak is pulled back, Cleff reveals his face a bit. He goes, "Hello there. It's been a while. How are you doing, Poppin?" He's like, "Interesting riffraff "you're bringing to my home this day."

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Why do people keep calling us that?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: To be fair, we are.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "I was referring to Cleff! Cleff, why do you come and bother me with my day's work? What do you "want? You're saying something about your little mistake, your problem?"

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Look, this guy is funding to take care of the spinning death machine that's in your guys' basement. This should be a city-funded issue, but this guy is being a good, noble citizen and funding it himself so we can come and make a quick buck and kill your death robot. Can we please just go kill your damn death robot?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: He looks at Cleff. "Is this true?" Cleff nods. "Actually, yes. I know it's been a problem "for a while and I figured, about time I cleaned up that mess myself, if you don't mind." The Wardenhelm stops for a second and looks amongst the rest of you. "Right, okay. You have what "appears to be an interesting crew of exterminators you've brought to me. What do you want from me? I "assume you have come here for trade or for looking for some sort of recompense. I would like to know "what that is before we move further into this. No one steps inside here wishing to do us, how you "say? Charity work."

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Oh, of course. That makes perfect sense, and of course a man of your stature would be smart enough to know that such a thing is true. We, honestly-- we will admit we may have a favor, a very minor favor, to ask if everything goes well and we do, in fact, survive this encounter. In return, also, we will be gathering very valuable data on how to defeat these sort of automatons, which will be put into your possession and would definitely help you deliver something that could help with the war effort. This sort of data could get back to the people in charge and help them defeat machines in the future. We're trying new techniques, new ways to defeat these sort of automatons.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: You look like a man who's willing to climb a ladder.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I think you could go far. We'd be happy to help.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: War is a great time for opportunity, my friend.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: We may discuss, perhaps, if we can help-- we have two friends who are currently in your system, and we would be more than happy to discuss a means of maybe resolving their issue with you. Not innocence, but just coming to a conclusion that is mutually agreeable.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Make a persuasion check with advantage, with aiding from Beau and a very persuasive argument, actually.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Man, I love bullshitting.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: (laughs) High-fivesies from across the table.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Persuasion? God, please, for once in your miserable life. Oh man, eight.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Oh, buddy.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Not life, just this campaign, Taliesin.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I know.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Well, perhaps we can discuss, but I would like to see possibly this deed you wish to do done "first. I do not wish to talk contracts with those who are about to die, if you know what I'm saying."

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Hardly waste your time.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Who would?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Very well." He looks past you to the escort of guards that have followed you in. "Lead them to "the subterranean sealed chamber. Allow them to encounter our issue, and should they survive, "return them to me with proof of the deed. Should they not survive, we will not speak of this ever "again. Good luck. I will be here waiting to hear of your successful endeavor. Now, leave me to my "work." He goes and sits back down in his chair.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: We're doing this now?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Of course we are. Anyone want the node?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: If I'm going to be throwing tar at this thing, maybe I should have it.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Or Caleb. Well, who's going to be throwing --

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Who's going to be throwing the tar? You with your Mage Hand, maybe?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I could.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: We'll heat it up. Caleb will heat it up, you'll throw it in, and then I'll be using some ice to try and cool the thing down once it's in there.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Yasha and I can try and pin it down, maybe corner it.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Once it starts opening up the armor, we'll just go to that one particular plate and start ripping a hole in it.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Start ripping the plates off.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Chopping the plates off.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Okay.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Let's heat that tar up before entering.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Let's get to the door, heat it up--

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: We'll get through doors, set the node, set everything we need into action.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Cleff and Rissa balk there as you guys are having this conversation. Rissa goes, "If it's not "a problem, I'll stay here with my dad and we'll just wait to hear what happens. We're not much in "the way of charging into the fray."

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Of course. You have tasked experts with this job.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Of course. Cleff pushes past and goes, "But before you go, I just want once more to express my "extreme gratitude for your putting yourself out there for my well-being. A Tinkertop never forgets "these deeds, and should you return safely, I will be in your debt." He bows and the cloak (thumps) onto the ground,and he goes, "Oh." He picks it back up and bows a little less this time.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Any last tips, Cleff?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Be careful?"

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: That's a good one.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: What kind of feet does it have again?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Oh, it doesn't have feet. It rolls."

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Ball bearings?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Hamster ball.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: We'll see. Slow it down. I don't know, we'll find out.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I don't know.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: All right. So the guards will take us down?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You guys currently have a group of six crownsguard from the outside and a couple of prison guards that will lead you there.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Tank this, and you'll be all right. It's just swords.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: I want to get a good look at it, but this sounds like a fun challenge.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Fjord, you got a plan? Jester?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Jester goes, "Well, don't die, and if you fall over, I'll try to get you not on the ground anymore."

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: She can't. She's out of spells.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: How is she out of spells? You guys took a long rest.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Didn't we use a bunch?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: No, we took a long rest.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: She used two Locate Objects, I know that.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Those are high-level spells.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: They're 2nd-level, I think. Isn't it?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Okay. Does it say how many spells she has left?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: It should.

lines.name: MATT
