lines.text: Yeah, Locate Object is 2nd-level.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: To be fair, I think we were going to rest, and we decided against it. We decided to go.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Oh, it reset, but she definitely had used some.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: We know she used two--

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: She's used two 2nd-level spells.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: She has used two 2nd-level spells?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: So we'll mark those in there. If she had another, it's fine. She's not here to keep track.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Do we want her to have anything pre-cast? I don't think Duplicity will matter, but maybe a Spiritual Weapon already called up?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Spiritual Weapon is a good idea.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Just have it already. Let's--

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Well, it only lasts for a minute.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Oh, then let's wait then. All right.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: In case this all goes tits-up, do we want to try to talk to these guards and maybe figure out what cell the Schusters are in?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: You're welcome to try.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I'm not talking to them. But someone with more charisma than me?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Certainly not me.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Fjord's literally the only one that can charm a guard. Unless we bribe a guard.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: That is incorrect.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Oh. Charming Caleb.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: (clears throat) I can speak when I have to.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Do some Suggestion stuff?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I mean, is that worth doing now?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: No I can just talk.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I mean, if we die, does it matter?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: No, but I mean if the warden doesn't give us what we want.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: We can talk to the guards on the way out.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Okay. But we're in the prison.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Yeah, but we're going to be in the prison when we're done.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: All right.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: That's fair.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Okay.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: (laughs) Assuming we live.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: The guards have led you away from that end of the chamber, down the hall, back to the main hallway that enters deeper into the Gearhold Prison. Following that down for another 80 or so feet, that main open hallway comes to an end, and there are a number of other small hallways that protrude. The guards lead you down the one on the left. You can see two immediately that branch off on the far end of that main open way. That left-side pathway leads to a set of stairs that spirals down to a second floor. Then a third floor. Then a fourth floor. The fourth floor is the bottom of these stairs, and you're now probably guessing, from the time it's taken you to descend the spiral staircase, maybe an additional 100 to 120 feet below the entrance and the actual level base of the mountain. At this point, you continue down a hallway and there are cells to your right and left. As you enter the space, the cells are very well-fortified, and behind the bars, in the dark, dark red ember-like torchlight that faintly glows and lights elements of this hallway, as you continue down, you can see shapes, humanoid shapes locked behind bars, of all shapes and sizes. As you begin to pass one on the right, you watch as a figure lurches up to the bars, pushes up to the edge, and what faint bit of red light you can see illuminating a face that looks scarred by a large, heavy clawmark down one side, the eye glued shut from the healing process. You see this toothy, rotten grin underneath as a nasty smell of breath emanates from its heavy breathing, and as you pass by, it says, "Hey. Are you going to come back, are you? Where are you going? Where "are you going? Come back!" And you walk past. One of the guards takes their shortsword and clangs it across the metal and goes, "Keep back, keep back."

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Mr. Schuster, you look terrible! I yell very loud to see if anybody responds to the name.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: To what name?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Mr. Schuster.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Schuster? Okay. You listen. Make a perception check.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Yeah, sure.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Oh, that's a 15.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. You listen out, and you hear a few voices chuckle and some shifting of people that are now making their way to the front of the cell to see what this arriving group of strangers is, but nothing out of the expected ordinary reacting to that name.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Worth a shot.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: And then, at the end, you come to what looks to be an iron door that is currently sealed shut, with what looks to be rung after rung after rung of chains pulled through, across bars, locked with three padlocks.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Is this the door?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: The main guard sitting there goes, "Aye, it is." He pulls out a ring of keys.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: When's the last time you opened it?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "When we sealed it."

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Which was--?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "About a little over two years ago."

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: How big is this chamber in here?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "It leads down, splits in the middle, and has two more sets of cells in the back side."

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Splits in the middle, two more sets of cells on the back side. So it looks like a big fork. Does it have a common way? Or is this thing patrolling halls?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "I don't know."

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: And what will happen when we go inside here? Are you locking us in?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Damn right."

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Until we knock on the door, I imagine.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Until which.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: With that, one latch, and one lock comes free, pulls it off, and hands it to the guard.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I'm going to look at the--

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Second lock, comes free.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: --the dodecahedron while we're at it.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You take a moment to concentrate on it.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Should we heat up the tar?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Let's heat up the tar.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Okay Nott, can you lift that thing up for me?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Lift?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I'll hold it since you're doing the thing.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Oh, sure.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Well, it's going to scald the bejeezus out of your hands if I--

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Okay, I'll use Mage Hand to hold it up.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I also have immunity to flame, so, or not quite immunity, but I don't really mind flame.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Well, I could semi-burn your hands, or not burn Nott's make-believe one.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Yeah, I'll hold it with my Mage Hand.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right. So with that, the bucket of tar is now being held aloft from the floating, spectral Mage Hand that Nott is controlling.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: We'll probably need some light in here, too.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: So, he can cast two spells; they have to be at third level.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Correct.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: And his cantrips are-- So if he casts Armor of Agathys, it's going to take up one of his levels.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Correct.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: And Hex would be another one?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Correct.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Everybody back away from this bucket. And I crackle my hands and send a Fire Bolt at the bottom of it.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right. So being careful not to destroy the bucket itself, which, while it is made of metal, you're uncertain of its structural integrity, but you do focus on a little, slow burn of this flame, controlling the Fire Bolt to be a gradual burn. As you do, you watch as the metal iron of the bottom of this bucket begin to heat to a dull orange, into a brighter orange. And after a few moments of concentrating, you can see a faint (bubbling). The tar seems to be heating and to a fairly more liquidy consistency than its rather cold and more solid form that you found it in.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Excellent.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: That is the most relaxed that spell has ever gone.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: (laughs) At which point the third lock comes off. The guards begin pulling the chains through the various loops until eventually the door is exposed, (creaking) opens. And on the inside, there's a few steps that descend into what looks to be a double door beyond that. One of the doors is partially opened and it is darkness with a faint red glow beyond that.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: This place is creepy as shit.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I turn to one of the guards. Is there any light in there, or are we going to need to bring our own?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "There's probably some light, but it wouldn't hurt to bring your own, especially for "that one." And points to Caleb.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Yasha, could I borrow a torch from you?

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Yes, of course.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: So your hands are free to work.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Yes. Good idea. Here.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Danke.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Fjord's going to cast Armor of Agathys on himself.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: So as Fjord touches the front of his chest armor, you watch as the cold air solidifies, getting this mist and bits of ice crystal protruding from his leather armor.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Hope that is a good call. What would Fjord do? And Beau puts on her goggles.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You got it.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: (like Fjord) Eldritch Blast.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: May the Platinum Dragon guide you." Closes the door and you hear the chains on the opposite side being locked, as you all turn back, looking down the six or seven feet of descending stairs before it levels into the double doors, partially opened and the darkness beyond. And that's where we're going to take a quick break.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Ah! Oh, but we were about to fight.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Well, we're going to dive into that, just because if we go into a battle, it might take a little while. We'll take the break now, before that, and then we can dive into it immediately as we return.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Let's try diplomacy.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Perfect. Shiny blade balls are easy to talk to.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Dear spinning death machine.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Fantasmagoria. I'm definitely having some, yeah.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All righty, guys. So, we'll be back here in a few minutes, we're going to take a five or ten minute break to get ourselves comfy, (like Rissa) "food, water, and other releases of functions."

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Thanks, Rissa.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: (laughter)

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Wow indeed.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: But everywhere you look: to the right, left, and along the ground all you see are hundreds and hundreds of blade-like grooves in the stone.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: That's not good.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: This is as, you know, I've heard the kids say these days: Creepy AF.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Actually, it's got eyes and not ears, I don't think. When we saw the blueprints was there any way for it to detect sound or was it all visual?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Without your massive intelligence roll, you weren't able to discern that information, unfortunately.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: All right.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: (whispering) I'm going to assume yes. Hey Jester! (cooing)

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Let's pretend we're whispering.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: (cooing) Okay. Maybe Pass Without a Trace, Jester? (cooing)

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: We can do that. Let's cast Pass Without a Trace. I'm going to light up my sword.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: That is a 2nd-level spell, if I recall.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Wait, let's--

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Maybe not.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: So let's not do that yet.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Okay. Nevermind. Keep going.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I'm going to light up my swords.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Both of them?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Yeah, with ice.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: That brings me down to 49 hit points, so that's fun. Wow, that’ll be a lot of fun. That's thrilling. There's a door over there. Do you want to sneak over and see?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Sure. I'll sneak over to the door and try to unlock it.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Over here?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Or see if it's locked.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right. It is a set of prison bars. There is a gate that is currently locked. The bars themselves, once again, you can see rows and rows of gashes and scrapes across the metal. They're bowed in a bit from impacts repeatedly. It's slightly bent inward. You can attempt to pick a lock, if you'd like.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I'll pick a lock.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Go ahead and roll. That's proficiency bonus plus dexterity.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: That's is a 14.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: They're designed to hold prisoners, unfortunately, so they're fairly hardy locks. You spend a while with it and are unable to hit those tumblers. It looks like it's not going to open. Make a perception check as you're looking through the bars.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Four.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I sneak up behind Nott.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: (whispering) I can open this if you need me to. I just like to save my shit.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I don't know what's in it. I can't see anything through it, can I?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Not with that perception roll, no. You see bits of rock. You see some cloth on the ground, that's it.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Caleb, maybe save your shit for afterwards.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Also if I were to unlock it, it would be loud, so that's not good.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Can we put some light in there and maybe take a look at what's in there?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: What's in that room?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Yeah. Since we have an orb up, don't we? No, we have a torch.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yasha, you have the torch right? No, Caleb has the torch.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Caleb, you want to use the torch to take a look in there, maybe? I'm keeping an eye through this hallway and I think I'm going to slowly start scooting.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Start scooting this way?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: But against the wall.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: What an amazing mini.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Thank you.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Caleb, as you hold the torch up at the bars and look through, make a perception check with advantage. As you're following off Nott's lead and it's small chamber, you can make out quite a bit of detail.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Oh, that's good. 19.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Good. Glancing inside, you see that whatever scrape marks that mar the interior of this main chamber, there are none within this cell. Whatever this creature, this Gearkeeper construct is, it did not manage to breach these gates. However, on the opposite side you see three different bed set-ups for prisoners. Some that seem, either they were trying to claw their way out, or the impact of slamming on the other walls caused bits of it to fall in and collapse. There are piles of stone and fallen earth on the other side. You see three skeletons. They look like they've been decomposing for quite some time. Probably prisoners that couldn't escape, and had no other way out.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: That's sucks.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: That's rough.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Okay, we can check this off our list, probably. There are some dead inmates in here.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: If the thing comes out here we're all dead so we should probably figure out a way to stop it.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: We can all get in that room if we have to.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: All right, but I can't open it.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Normally you don't want to get trapped in a room with something bigger and spinning with 12 blades. I think we'd be better off holding this choke point.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: That's the hope, but we have these other options over here. Is there anything I can see from my perspective, from where I'm standing right now?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Make a perception check.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I knew you’d say that. That's a 16.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Your dark vision is 60 feet correct? You can just make out the details of another interior chamber. Looking within, portions of the walls inside are also equally scraped apart. Edges of the fine, well-set stonework have been marred with repeated gashes all over. It looks like beyond that there was another prison cell, but those bars have been breached, as they are currently bent, gnarled, and twisted and pulled out of place. The cell beyond it appears to be open.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I'm going to move up and go to the opposite side of where Molly is and peek down the opposite way, just like he did.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Anybody else moving anywhere?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: While people are moving around the room I whisper: Just for our options here. If we want to kick this off and don't mind getting its attention, I can magically unlock this door here, which will make a sound, and then instantly lock it. If we wanted to, we could all hustle inside here, and maybe attack at range? Just as an option.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Does the door have holes?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: The door is open but there are bars on this.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: That's not a door, it's just a cage.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yes, and it's partially bent inward from the impact. It looks like it sustained quite a bit of brunt force to it over time.

lines.name: LAIM
lines.text: That would put Beau and Yasha at a disadvantage, but the rest of us could take pot shots at it from in here.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: You know, I like that idea. Maybe Yasha and I can stand and hide and crouch in the corners while you guys get its attention and shoot it from range. What I would be afraid of is if we were all in there, and it eventually did what it did to those bars over there, and busted in. And we were all sitting ducks on the inside.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Well I could be wrong, but with what I know how to do, I don't think it can do that to this door, for a short amount of time.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: It looks like it--

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Do you have a plan?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Well, I'm talking about magic. I can magically seal this door. Unless it has a way to deal with that, it will not be able to get through.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: That's pretty good. Let's move quickly, though.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Make an intelligence check, Caleb, if you don't mind.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: That is 15.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 15. Okay. You were referring. I believe, to the spell Arcane Lock, right?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: "Impassable until it is broken, or the spell is dispelled or suppressed."

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yep. It can still be forced open; it's just a higher DC to do so. It's possible, but it makes it a much harder door to break through.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Okay.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You have a valid point to what you're saying, yes.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Can I still complete my perception check and see if I see down here?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Go for it. Make a perception check.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Not great. Seven.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Seven? Unfortunately, even with your darkvision, it's hard to look past that way. You can see another chamber. At your current vantage point, it's a little bit out of the way. It looks like there's not enough information. You'd have to get a little closer to make out the details.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Is there anything that would warrant a couple people hiding while some people got in the thing? Is there something that looks like Yasha and I could maybe hide? I'm a little disadvantage looking at this angle.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: There are some piles of rubble and portions of the walls that have collapsed inwards.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: So you can get up and get a little height if you want and we can also--

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: If we went inside that room, though--

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Those with range.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: The creature would probably give up and go back into hiding until we came out, I would assume.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Maybe, maybe not. Maybe it would keep pounding until you died.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: You could still Mage Hand the tar between the bars, right?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Sure.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Let's try it!

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: We don't even have to put the tar inside, it could be outside.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: That's what I'm saying. Caleb, can you lift that gate spell if we need to get back out?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Yeah, instantly.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: All right, Yasha, we're going to be on the outside, then?

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Yep.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: That's scary and dangerous.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: This is scary and dangerous work.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Wait, are you and Yasha going to be on the outside?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Well, we don't have any range.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Neither do I.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: You're going to be on the outside too. I thought we'd put all the ranged people in there and draw its attention to attack them, and then while it's there we can all gang up on it.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Three Amigos?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: It's a terrible idea, but go for it.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: So, what are you guys doing?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Yeah, let's do it.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: So you bruisers, you're staying out here?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: But we're going to hide amongst this rubble on the opposite side and you guys are going to start.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yasha, where are you moving to?

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: We're going to hide behind the rubble.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Right here?

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: And Beau as well.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Beau, you're moving over here as well?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Yeah. Can I get up on top of the rubble and crouch down?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I'm going to attempt to hide in the corner.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It's going to be hard to hide and climb it as well. We can do about there, as good as we can get, there.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Oh, Yasha, before I forget, I got you something.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: You did?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I hand her one of the silk flowers from the festival. It doesn't press well, but, you know.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: It is going to be very special. Thank you, Molly.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Got for you if we live.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Molly, are you staying there?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Yeah. I'm going to stay super crouched.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Does Jester have her Spiritual Weapon out?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: She doesn't yet.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Okay. Maybe we should get it ready.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Wait.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Wait, what?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I do not have the components I need for Arcane Lock. Damn it.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: What do you need?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: A lot of gold dust.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: A lot of gold dust?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: We can make some, right now!

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I know! Can we grind some gold really fast? File some?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Quietly!

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Quietly file down gold coins?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: All right, well, plan B.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Plan B. That's fine.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Do you want me to scout ahead to the area that you've seen?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Or the cat.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Or the cat, yes. How about the cat goes to the area where Molly has seen. Which, Liam, for you, is the bottom left of the picture I sent you.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: So where are you sending Frumpkin?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Into the last unexplored room.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: No, this is the one that--

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: The first unexplored room.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Send the cat.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Sending the cat to take a look--

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Scout with the cat. Kitty scout.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: This may be the end of the cat.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Yeah, okay. I'm going to back as far away from that door as I can, and I will send Frumpkin in.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Moving back in the corner with Beau and Yasha. Right about there, we'll say.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Ladies.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You begin to focus and Frumpkin heads to the right side of the fork into the chamber you've already looked into, towards the open cell doors that are currently pried off that archway. As Frumpkin glances past, make a stealth check for Frumpkin.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Yep. Oh. I don't have the cat paper with me in this state that I'm in, because I didn't know I'd be playing.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: That's okay.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: So I rolled a 15.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: LIAM. Yeah. Let's go with that.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: 15 plus cat.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Elements of it look scraped and dented. It looks like it's been doing some serious damage to it over time. As it sits there, resting, and Frumpkin approaches, you watch one of the tiny little metal plates (squeak) open, a lens pokes out towards Frumpkin, withdraws back in. The plate closes and about six of these long blade-like spider legs stick out of it as it pulls back and begins to roll forward at a very extreme pace.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I snap Frumpkin out of there.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It rolls forward. Frumpkin just manages to bamf out of this dimension as the object slams into the opposite wall. You guys feel the entire chamber suddenly (crash) from the impact and you hear this scraping of metal in the distance.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I'm going to re-cast Mage Hand and pick up the bucket of tar.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It rolls across the way and disappears into the other chamber.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I'm going to stealthily move forward, back where I was across from Molly.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Go ahead and make a stealth check, please.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Jesus Christ. This just got really--

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I have an interesting idea.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Nott, where do you want to go?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Towards the narrower hallway.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Here?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Yeah, just on the edge of it. Do I hear any movement or anything?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You do hear the same object shifting on the other side.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 15? Okay.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Oh no.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Nott, as you're there at the edge, and Beau's there. You glance in, now that you guys are close enough you can see shifting in there. You pay attention and you can see this other chamber is open with another cell off to the side. It slams into that door, spins around, and one of the lenses peeks around the corner right at where Beau had just moved into the far corner.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Jester is going to cast her Spiritual Weapon and put it right in the center of--

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: The room?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Yeah. A big nice shiny object to distract.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Where's Fjord going? Because we're about to go into combat.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Are we all pulling against the walls?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Where is Fjord going? Make Fjord go by the gate, maybe. Back a bit. Then Beau is going to take out those ball bearings.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Can we put Jester in the corner?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Jester can back up there.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Let's not kill our friends’ D&D characters.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: I need all of you to roll initiative.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: If we still have a bit of an action, I'm going to toss my bag of ball bearings and try and throw a bunch of ball bearings right here.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Sam, can you take a new picture and send it to me?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: As that happens, the legs, which are still out, rear backward and they retract as it runs itself rolling forward in your direction, ricocheting off that wall. The ball bearings, as it grinds across the bottom, get fired off like small impact bullets from the grinding of the metal plates and the force of it hitting. I need both Nott and Beau to make dexterity saving throws.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Oh god! Save? 21.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Oh wait, not with advantage, or no?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Not with advantage. Just a single roll.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Okay, 18 then.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You guys both manage to just duck out of the way, they don't seem to hit you. It's only a handful of them that upon the impact of it hitting stone and being pressured beneath, they shoot off in your direction.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Molly, ball bearings didn't work! Rolling for initiative?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Initiative rolls, guys. Roll for yourself, Beau, and then roll for Jester and Fjord as well.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I'll roll for Jester.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I'm rolling for Fjord.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Hang on.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: So fucked.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Sorry. Another person's character.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 25 to 20 anybody? 20 to 15?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Whoa! Who are you?

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: I don’t know! But I don't know what to do this early on.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: It's going to be a lot of dodging.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 15 to ten?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Fjord is 14. Beau is ten.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right. Ten to five?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Seven.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Six.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Seven for me as well. And Jester is six.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Caleb and Jester are in the same--

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Caleb and Jester are six, Molly and Nott are both seven.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It turns, and you can see now the six spider-like blade legs sticking out of it. Six more shoot out of the top of it, and all begin whirling around and begin spinning. There, amongst this chaos, you see the lens sitting right there, just barely peeking through its armored shell. Yasha, you're up first.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Okay, I would like to rage.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All righty.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: It's the time. Do I just go in?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: This is it.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Can I get to it?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: (counting) You just barely get into its range with your barbarian speed. You rush in, anger on your face. You draw your Magician's Judge blade in the air.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Oh no.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Do you have advantage?

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: I didn't reckless. 11.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 11, unfortunately, does not hit. Your blade scrapes across its armored exterior, not finding purchase in any of its innards.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Divine Fury, can you do it on the first or only if the first--

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: The first attack that hits.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: That first attack that hits.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Correct.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Can I use my extra attack?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah, you get that every round.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: That’s better. That’s 21.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 21 hits! Roll damage.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: This is it.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: We’re so fucked.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Kick it in the ball!

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Okay! 12.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You roll 2d6 for the weapon, 3d6 for the Divine Fury. Oh no, it’s additional half your level.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Yeah. Plus three. It’s 2d6 plus three.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 2d6 plus three, right?

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Yeah. So 12.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 12, and then your rage damage, which is two.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Oh right! Yeah, 14.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Is it Divine Fury still?

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: No, because that’s only the first.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: That’s what I’m saying. You get Divine Fury for this hit because your first one hit, this one does get it.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Okay! So an extra d6. Oops. Okay, an extra two. So 16 total.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. With that--

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Clang!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Sparks go streaking off and the blade gets jettisoned off. You have to hold it before it gets shot off the side of it, the clockwork pushing it out of its innards. The armor plate clicks over and guards its space.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Okay. I’ll stay.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Did it lose a blade just now?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It looks like it’s bent back a bit. That ends Yasha’s turn. Fjord is up next.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Yeah, Fjord!

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Fjord’s going to cast Hex!

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Hex, ma’am!

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I’m going to Hex that "robit."

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Hex the "robit."

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: The "robit" is a-hexed.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Hang on, wait. That doesn’t-- no. It doesn’t mess with Armor of Agathys, just checking.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You have a concentration on Fjord for this.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: This is Hex. Then he’s going to take his falchion, he’s going to flip it, and from the hilt, he’s going to go (firing). He’s going to cast Eldritch Blast because I saw him do that once before.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Like a from-the-hip-shotgun. I like it.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: He did it before. I’m ripping it off from Travis.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: That’s two shots. Fire twice.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Pew pew! 15? Seven plus eight.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Seven plus eight, 15? You fire, the blast hits and disperses against the armor. It does not hit.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Right, that magic shit. He’s going to try it one more time. That bounced. Okay, that’s better. 13 plus seven.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 20? 20 does hit. Roll a d10 plus four plus another d6 for Hex. Not a d4, plus four damage to whatever you roll on the d10.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Five plus four is nine damage.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Plus three from?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: No, that’s it. I rolled a three and a two plus a four. It’s not a lot of damage. I rolled crappy.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: That finishes Fjord’s action and bonus action.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: What did you roll to hit?

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Say again?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: What did you roll to hit?

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Rolled a 21.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: 21. So we know 20 hits.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Thank you.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Now, Beauregard--

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Is Fjord going to stay where he is?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Yes, because I’m scared. Beau is going to--

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Beau doesn’t go yet because it’s now the Gearkeeper’s turn.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I’m sorry.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: That’s okay.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I didn’t know.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: That’s all right.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: The Gearkeeper.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Beginning of its turn, it’s going to attempt to roll over Yasha to go into the chamber. Yasha, you need to make an athletics or acrobatics check.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Okay, okay, okay.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You’re raging, so you have advantage on your acrobatics check.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: That athletics is already sweet, though.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Oof. Oh. Nine.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: No. First off, you suffer--

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: I rolled the wrong ones.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Seven points of piercing damage as it rolls over and the blades kick into you.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Is that halved because I’m raging?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It is halved. An additional three points of bludgeoning damage as you are crushed beneath its weight, and you are knocked prone.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: That’s a total of-- you said three and-- I’m sorry.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It was seven before three. So it’ll be ten halved, so you take five points of damage.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Five points of damage, okay.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Nott, you do get an attack of opportunity with a melee weapon, if you have one, but you have your crossbow out?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I probably have my crossbow out.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: So yeah, you don’t do much of an attack there.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I’ll hit it with my crossbow.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Roll an attack. Improvised weapon for a melee.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Yeah. 18.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 18 just hits.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: 18 is what hits, y’all!

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Do I get a point of damage?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You get a point of damage on it.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Yeah! Eat it!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Your hand crossbow, as you slam into it, you look back and it looks like some of the wood is splintered somewhat. You’re like, "Oh." It’s not enough to the point where it looks like it’s not going to function, maybe, but it’s going to need some repairs.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I need a new crossbow, is what I need.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Well, there you go. As it turns around, the front of it, where the lens is, the lens retracts in. The plates in front suddenly open, leaving this open, black, vacuous space, like a mouth or a gate, opens in front. You hear this very high, whirring, winding sound. You see sparks inside, and a blast of heated shrapnel shoots outward in a 30 foot spray.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: It can do that?!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Against both of you, right there.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Cleff, you madman.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: I need you both to make a dexterity saving throw, please.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Oh, rough. 12.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: That’s not too bad. 22.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Success, so you take half damage.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Okay.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: That is 25 points of piercing damage to you Nott.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Because I hit it with my thing, do I no longer have a reaction?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Correct.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Oh, shit.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Now you know about the reactions.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: 25 points of damage?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Of piercing damage, and halved for you, so you take 12.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Its shrapnel blast is done. That’s the end of its turn. That brings us to Beau. You’re up.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Okay. Being hit with hot shrapnel, I’m going to do a cool pole vault over Nott.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Over this way?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I guess. Wait, where’s Yasha? Yasha’s here?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yasha’s prone on the ground.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I’ll get on the other side of where Yasha will eventually be.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Oh, so around here?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Uh-huh. On this side of it.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You’re moving into melee?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Yep.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Got it.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Then attack!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Go for it.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Whack it with my stick. I’m going to try and jam it up in between one of those gears.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: You also have the mouth you can throw the tar up in there.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: That’s terrible. That doesn’t hit, that’s like, ten.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Ten misses. The first strike with your staff just scrapes off of its armor, no impact.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I’m going to readjust and try and go for it again. That’s the exact same roll. Those are two twos in a row.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: The second one, you strike again. This time, one of the blades swings outward, and thankfully, the blade doesn’t hit the staff to cut the wood, however, it does, the backhand, impact it and prevent the blow from actually striking its body.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Two twos.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: That’s not fun.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I guess I will do an unarmed attack.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You go and punch the armored sphere.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: So frustrated that I can’t get my staff up there, I’m just going to go and try and whack it with my fist.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Go for it.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: 17, which just misses.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You hit it, but you go (metallic clang), "Oh!" You can feel that from the knuckles right to the funny bone.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Do I have any more movement?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: From there, you have ten feet.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Can I back up towards, or even get this-- I’m just going to stay where I am.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. Finishing Beau’s turn, that brings us to Nott and Molly--

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Oh wait, hang on, as a bonus act-- no. I used my bonus action. Fuck. Okay, keep going.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Is its lens out?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Its lens appears to be out currently, just surveying the scenario, yes.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: So go for the lens?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Go for it.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Bonus action, I will use the Mage Hand to deliver the tar right on that lens.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: I’ll say, for the purposes of aiming on this, with your intention, go ahead and make a d20 attack roll adding your perception bonus.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: There is no bonus to that. Well that’s-- how do you feel about that? Well, it fell so we’ll never know what it was. 17!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: (cheering)

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Our plan worked perfectly. How far am I from the thing?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Technically, you are ten feet from it.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Do you think I’m in melee range?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Probably.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: The blades have a bit of reach, so you are technically in melee.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: That’s a ten-foot blade reach.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Can I use my action to disengage?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Disengage generally is an action.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Okay. I will disengage and run.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Which direction?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Straight to the place I just came from.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right. You can get there. You can go one more, if you want to.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Sure.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Now you spin around with your crossbow, not suffering any attack of opportunity. All right, Molly.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Can I see anywhere where there seems to be a crack in the armor and make a--

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You may, yes. Well, you can try and inspect.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I want to see if there’s anything that looks like a good target to start doing some damage to.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: At the moment, it hasn’t taken a lot of damage, and it’s hard to see if any--

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Is there a plate open or anything at the moment near me?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: The only plate that’s open is the one that has the lens visible, but it’s really close to the body and right now there’s blades spinning in its space.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I’m going to try and get to the side without the blade. I’m going to try and chop open one of the plates on the back. I’m going to start hacking away at it. Actually, even with the blades, there’s an open place right now? Is there a place for me to start poking the tender insides?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: At the moment, not really. It’s still fresh in battle, and its armor plates are pretty much protecting all of it.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I’m going to try and find one armor plate and start going to town.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Where are you going to attack its construction?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I’m going to run over to the opposite side, flank it with the lollipop.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Oh, with the lollipop? All righty. You’re going to be right there, on top of the door?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Mm-hmm.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All righty, take your attacks.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: First attack is a natural 20!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Nice! Make your damage on that and roll the second attack. That’s--

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: 2d6 with ice damage. That’s (counting) 17 points of damage.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 17 points of damage. Nice!

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: That’s 18 points of damage because of the Summer’s Dance.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Correct.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Then the next one, Summer’s Dance again, is not quite as good, 12. That does not hit.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You’ve actually bent them to the point where they cannot reform this armored mesh. It’s trying to correct itself, but busted in place. The second strike, as you come down, one of the blades catches and parries it off to the side. No impact on the second blow.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Okay. Going for a third strike.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Go for it.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 14 does not hit. This is a tough mother. You go to strike a third time. You do hit, but it just doesn’t cut through. The blade shakes a bit. You pull back, cursing yourself.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Is it worth seeing if it’s going to-- well, it’s blinded, so it’s got disadvantage if it tries to even hit me with an attack, so I’m going to try and back off and climb up that little hill.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: For those questioning, even though it is blinded, it lowers its attack, because some people are like, "Attacking things with blindness have advantage!". Because it is nothing but a spinning, whirring of blades, and technically it has multiple forms of sight, it is not granting advantage on the attacks against it.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I’m going to try and hop up that hill really quickly.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All righty. You try and move this way?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Yep.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right, you’re hopping up this edge.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: As high as I can get to get out of its range.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay, so that will be probably over here, best you can for this.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Yeah. Right over there is good.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You manage to scoot yourself up to that side and climb away. It does swing out towards you. It does have disadvantage on the attack because of the blindness. That will bring it to a 13 to hit.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: That does not hit.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You manage to duck out of the way.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: And now it doesn't have a reaction anymore.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Ooh, nice.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: That ends your turn there. That brings us to Caleb and Jester.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: [no audio]

lines.name: SAM, TALIESIN
lines.text: We can't hear you.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Why can't we hear you?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Yeah, we can hear you now. Oh wait, do it again.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Can you hear me right now?

lines.name: ALL
lines.text: Yes!

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: After Mollymauk cleared the way, is the thing on its own? Is it in a 40-foot cube of empty space, or are any of my allies in it?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: No, it is surrounded. There's Beau to one part of it, it's about ten feet from Yasha, and about 15 feet from Molly.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: It's a pretty tight box we're in.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: We're in a tight box.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Slow is out the window. I pull out my clay cat's paw and mutter a few words, and I will cast Maximilian's Earthen Grasp. A soil cat's paw comes up out of the ground and swipes. It needs to make a strength save. 16.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Strength save. That is a 15. What is your DC?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: 16. It's held in place, and it takes 2d6 damage. Hold on. It takes five points of bludgeoning damage.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Five points of damage, got it. It is held in place.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: It has to use an action to break out.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Are you going to stay back in the corner where you are?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: If I can squish even one square further away from it, I would.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You are backed up into the current corner, as far away as you can get. That ends Caleb's turn. Jester's up. What are you guys doing with Jester?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: First off, we're going to have the Spiritual Weapon take a swipe right at where the plates are already broken, and hit it again. Which is a bonus action, and a plus seven to hit. Oh, that's not it. It's around here somewhere. There it is. That's a 15.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: That was 15 to hit?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Wait, wait. (counting) Yeah, 15.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: That's your bonus action. Jester still has an action.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I don't think this is going to do anything.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: (singing) Playing with your friends' D&D characters!

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I was thinking of trying maybe a--

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Simple Sacred Flame?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: We could do Sacred Flame, or if you were nearer I'd say Cure Wounds. Or we could do a Guiding Bolt.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Hey, that's a classic.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: (like Jester) "We're going to do Guiding Bolt." You roll this one.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: (imitating Taliesin) We're going to do Guiding Bolt.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: That's a 26.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 26 definitely hits! Roll damage on that.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: That's 4d6 radiant damage.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yes, and the next attack on it has advantage.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Okay. Come on, Jester. Any pluses?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: No, just 4d6.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 14 points of damage. Nice. As the released Guiding Bolt slams into the side of it, the blast of divine energy explodes. Some of the plates dent inward and now you see this glittering energy that's entwining its body, giving you a glimmer of some of the weak points to help you hit where it'll hurt the most. Does that finish Jester's turn? She going to stay where she is, or is she going to move?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I feel like we should open up a little bit. I think she's going to see if she can crawl over to the door, so she can hide behind it in case something bad happens.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay, so she tries to move into the doorway.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: That door actually opens and closes, Matt?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: In fact, she might be smart-- she has to keep the Spiritual Weapon in visual range, right?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Okay. She's going to just use that as some cover.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Top of the round, Yasha.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Okay. So I'm going to (stuttering) pick myself up.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: That's half your movement, so you still have 20 feet of movement.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Can I flank? Get around so Beau and I are-- yeah.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Your first attack has advantage anyway, because of the Guiding Bolt.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Right. That's right.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Up the butt. Does it have a butt, Matt?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You cannot discern any sort of rear end or exhaust port.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Does it poop?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You'll find out, I'm sure.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 22 hits. Roll damage on that first strike.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: That's a lot.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Everyone poops.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: We can't see the sphincter!

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Oh wait, no! Everybody poops unless they're an android, because then they must be destroyed.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Oh yeah, sure. That's right.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Poop, poop.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 16 points of damage. Cutting through bits and pieces of it. Nice. That's your first strike on it. As you jam down, grinding off, some of the metal plates pull away from it, and once again lock, unable to push back into place. There's small places where you're starting to buckle parts of its exterior armor, so its AC actually does go down by one.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Ooh!

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Oh, okay. So I get another attack?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: That's your first strike. You get a second attack.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: So we now know at least a 17 will hit.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: That does not have advantage, right?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You do, because you're currently flanking with Beau.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: (singing) Because we're flanking, bitch!

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: That's a 25.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 25 does hit. Roll damage.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Not an extra, because not Divine Fury?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Correct. Just 2d6 plus five.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Okay. That's 11.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 11 points of damage. Nice! Yasha, busting it out. All right, that finish your turn?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Just a reminder that everyone is rolling at advantage while the Cat's Paw holds it.

lines.name: ALL
lines.text: Ooh.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Oh, because it's restrained? Right!

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Blinded and restrained right now.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It's now Fjord's go.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: (exaggerated Texan drawl) I do a cowboy saunter up behind the-- I go under the lollipop and I use the magical field of the lollipop to make it like me walking through a glitter fog machine. I walk up to him, thank you. I walk up, and I'm going to attack with my falchion.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Go for it. Make two strikes with the falchion. First attack with advantage.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I'm sorry, Travis.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: That's exactly how he talks.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I'll take that 18, plus that seven.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right, that hits. The first attack, that's a d8 plus--

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Plus Hex.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: A d8, plus four, plus Hex.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: And then I'm going do Booming Blade with my action. Is that not how this works?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: No.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Okay, no. I'm going to do damage.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Booming Blade is a cantrip that only gives you one attack as part of the action.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Never mind, then I'm just going to hit it real hard.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: That's okay.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Six plus two plus five, so eight plus five.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right, that's 13 damage.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: See my math? I can only do half. I'm so tired.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It's been a long day. I know. Fjord comes up holding the falchion, hand swings down, carving through, the shadows of the Hex helping the blade dig in that much more. You have a second attack.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Okay, it's still advantage, right?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yep.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Yeah, hyuck hyuck hyuck. I'll take that 16.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Meanwhile, Travis is somewhere singing "Dear Theodosia."

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Yeah, somewhere he's getting a nosebleed while this happens. Four plus four plus five, so 13?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 13 points of damage? That hits again. With that, with Fjord carving into it twice with the blade, each time the falchion is carving through each section, more and more armored pieces are pushing inward. It's not enough to lower its AC, but it is taking more and more damage. Slowly you're piercing its heavily protected exterior.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Do I have any more movement?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Fjord would have, yeah.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Like ten more?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Ten more feet.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: He's going to back up to that gate a little bit.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: One or two steps?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Two, if he can.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right. Still in melee.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: He's still in melee? Okay.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It's a ten foot range. That ends your turn?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Yep. That's Fjord's turn.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right. That brings us to the Gatekeeper construct. The lens has retracted back into its armor, and you hear this sound (whirring) the lens comes out, and it has cleared the tar from its lens.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Cleff, you sick bastard!

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Damn it! So he did think of that! He put that in his notes!

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: He did! Yeah, he said he didn't have a failsafe. That lying old bastard.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Lying sack of shit.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: The lens retracts and pops out the back side, immediately scanning the source of what's currently clutching it, and its dirt-driven arcane paw. The blade arms on the top retract in, and instead these two heavy iron spears lock into place, and both go firing outward towards Caleb.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Oh no! Not my sweet boy!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: They have disadvantage, because it is restrained. With disadvantage, it's going to be an 18 to hit for the first one.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Shield.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: So it misses.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All righty. Second one, 16 and 18. 16 plus eight; it's going to be 24.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Oh, that will hit. Those will hit.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: The first one, the shield (clang). It ricochets off and floats off in the background spinning. The second one, however, pierces through the shield and hits you in the chest.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: That's not going to be good.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: That's going to be 17 points of piercing damage.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Good, good, good.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: And you are pinned to the wall. It actually pierced through your chest and is now holding you into the stone. Your movement is zero, and you are considered restrained against the wall.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I also have to make a concentration check.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You do. So go ahead and make a constitution check. With the damage taken, it has to be at least a ten or higher.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Hold on. I rolled a three.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: No, and with that, the paw is broken.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: (cat yowl)

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Shit.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Well, it's still there. It's just not holding it. Wait, no, it's gone.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: No, it's gone. You’ve lost concentration on the spell. And it did recharge its shrapnel blast.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I was really wanting advantage on all my attacks. Oh, but I have Yasha flanking. Okay.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: That being the case, that’s going to finish its turn. It's going to stay put. Because the blades now grind out again and begin whirring and spinning around its orb-like body. That brings us to Beau. Beau, at the top of your turn, because you are within five feet of it, you automatically take whirling blade damage by being in proximity.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Matt, was that 17 points of damage?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: That was, yes.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: I'm also in proximity.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yes. So at the top of your turn, you'll take it as well. That's six points of slashing damage to you, Beau. Now take your turn.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Six. Apply changes. (singing) D&D Beyond!

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: My mustache is falling off, so I better hold it on with another mustache.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: No, stop.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Fuck you, Sam!

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Okay, I get advantage on this attack, right?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You do, because you're flanking.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Okay, I'm going to try and once again get up in those plates.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Get up under them plates!

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: That one's cocked underneath. Okay!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: A four and a six.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: No, it was cocked underneath. It was tilted.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. That dice is weird for that because then you rolled the d20 twice.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Then I won't use it.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right. So roll the second one.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Okay, 17 plus seven.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: For the second strike?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I rolled both at the same-- No, first to strike.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: The first roll you had was a four on the top, so roll for your second die.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Okay.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Just keeping it kosher.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Okay. It's still an 18.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 18 hits, yeah. Go ahead and make your strike with your staff.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Okay. Four.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Four points of damage?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Plus another four.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: So that's eight. As your staff strikes across it, the wood of it, while damaging, doesn't seem to be having as strong an impact as you’d hope against its armored form.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Because it's not magical?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It seems to be resistant to something that is not magical.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Oh no.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Even though I still hit, can I try to stun it with a Stunning Strike?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Sure. Let's go ahead and-- I'm pretty sure--

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I haven't hit anything in so long and I just want to stun something. I've had such bad luck the past two fights.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: I'm so sorry.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I haven't been such a good monk.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Yeah. (coughing) That's rough, buddy.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: So far we've learned today that Fjord sounds like this: (goofy chuckling)

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: By the rules as written, because it mentions the ki of the inside of the body-- there is no ki, but there is a magical core. I'll say that when you strike the body intending to stun it, while you're not affecting the ki of a soul, the ki that you're expending might interfere with its central energy core. So it has to make a constitution saving throw.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Okay.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: That's going to be a 17. What's the DC?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Yeah.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It's a 12 plus five, I'm sorry.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Yeah, it saves.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You have another attack.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I'm going to do that. Still have advantage, right?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You do.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Man, it will be really awesome when that monk ability, that's core of my class, actually works. 17 plus seven.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: That hits. Go ahead and roll damage for that. Second strike with your staff.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Six.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right, six.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Plus another four, so ten total. Sorry.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It takes five points of damage as the second strike is still somewhat deflected by the armor of its body.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Since I have two hits, can I do Extract Aspects? Spend a ki point?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You can. You spend a ki point. Since we've changed or errata-ed it, it does not make a saving throw. You just get to learn--

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I get to learn two things now?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: At level six you get to learn two things.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Can I learn its lowest saving throw ability?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: (laughter)

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Useless!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Not against some spells.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Hey Molly, you want to mock this asshole to death?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I think it would still go poorly, but let's see if it comes to it.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Okay. I'm going to take my last attack.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay, go for it.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Still at advantage, right?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yep.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Okay, I hit with a 15 plus seven, so a 22.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: That hits.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I have a d6 now. Five damage.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Five damage reduced to two. This time, you hit with your fists. Again, it scrapes through the armor, and you're bleeding at the knuckles from the impact. It's hard to break through its shell.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I'm feeling so useful, you guys.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: This is a rough fight for a monk at level five, unfortunately.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I got a crazy idea.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: That finish your turn, Beau?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Yeah, I'm going to stay exactly where I am.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay, that finishes Beau's turn. Nott and Molly, you're up.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: You first, please.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I'm going to scoot around and fire a crossbow at it.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Go for it.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: That's a 15 plus seven to hit.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: That hits. Go ahead and roll damage.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Is it within melee and stuff?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It is.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Well, that wasn't good at all!

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Hey, Beau.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: That's eight.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Eight points of damage, reduce that in half because it's a non-magical source. That's four points of piercing to it.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I'll use my Fury Of The Small. That's another five points.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Are you using my friend's success to try and make me feel better?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: No, he actually only did four points of damage. Sam only did four.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Oh, you're trying to use my friend's failure to make me feel better.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It gets stuck in some of the gears. You see some sparks from the inside, but it doesn't fully pierce its shell.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Terrible. I can't really do anything. You know what, I'll take out my last burning bolt, that should be magical, load it up and fire that.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Go for it. That is a magical bolt.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: But that doesn't hit. I just wasted it. It's 14.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: The bolt doesn't impact. It just glides off the armor. It lands somewhere in the distance. You don't know if it's retrievable or not yet.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Damn it!

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: It's impossible to take you seriously.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: What are you talking about?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I can't even-- I'm rooting for Nott, then I look at you and I feel weird.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Molly, you're up.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I'm going to duck back a little bit.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I'm going to run in and try to do a little bit more damage in here. I'm coming in and taking three more shots. I caught it. It's all good. That one misses.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right, you move in. Go for it.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: That one hits. That's a 19.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: First strike it dodges; it moves out of the way. The second strike actually makes an impact, so roll for that.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: That's okay. (counting) That's 12 points of damage.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 12 points of damage, all righty. Carves through with the second strike.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: For a third, slightly less exciting attack. Natural 20!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: This is your off-hand, so it's not a magical weapon.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: But its magicked up.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Correct, so the extra rite damage is magical, but the actual blade will be halved.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Okay, that's fine.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: So roll the d6 for your blade.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: That's two to three, so that's five.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Five reduced to two. So two damage plus this, doubled. Well no, sorry, the two is doubled because it was a crit. So it would have been four plus three, which is seven.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: So it was a five.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Sure, it's five damage.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: And then six because this is doubled.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You see it shifting rapidly trying to figure out its situation and tactically maneuver best it can.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I'm going to see if I can hop back up out of-- am I ever getting out of melee, or am I not getting out of melee?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Or all the way up to the top.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: It will still get an attack of opportunity on me, though. Without disadvantage now.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: At the moment, no.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: You know, I'm going to stick around for now.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I'm going to keep a flanking point. I’m going to move a little bit, so that we’re spread out around it. So it has to make some decisions.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Can he use the rest of his movement to work on his Jester accent?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Sure.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: That's going to be a lot of movement.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Caleb and Jester, you're up next. Caleb, you're currently pinned to the wall. You're muted also, I can't hear you.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: What comes after Jester and I in the initiative order?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yasha does.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Yasha does, and then the thing?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yes, Yasha, Fjord, and then the thing.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: And Jester is with you.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Yeah, I know. I'm having trouble thinking straight because there is a blade through my gut and my rib cage. So I grasp the cat's paw again, I don't try to pull myself loose, and I cast Maximilian's Earthen Paw again. Strength save.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You're still maintaining concentration, but it did not seem to grasp it at this moment. All right, that ends Caleb's turn. Jester's up.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: No, don't do that! Go back. Sorry, keep going.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Should I try something offensive or healing-based, do you think? How are you doing, Caleb?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Bad.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Okay, so we're going to do this. We're going to run out and cast Healing Word on Caleb.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay, so step back through the door a little bit there. What level?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Level one.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: So a d4 plus four to Caleb.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Yes, 1d4 plus four. So that's seven points.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Caleb, you heal seven points. That's a bonus action from Jester. What's next? You can only use a cantrip since you've cast a bonus action spell.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: So the Spiritual Weapon?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You've already used the Healing Word, unfortunately.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: But I can use my action for the bonus action.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It doesn't work that way.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: You can't up a bonus action to an action?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: No.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Man! So I can't cast anything higher than level one either, can I?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Or a cantrip.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I can only cast cantrip at this point. I would have done that in the reverse order if I had been thinking about things. Well, what do I got? I got a-- oh!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: But Caleb's healed a little bit.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Caleb's healed and that's good. Do we want to try?

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Yeah, I say give it a go.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Let's try Toll the Dead.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Constitution saving throw?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: It's a wisdom saving throw.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Wisdom to Toll the Dead?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: You point at one creature you can see within range, and the sound of a-- you succeed at a wisdom saving throw or take 1d8 of necrotic.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It is wisdom, you are right. So that would put it at a 14. Because it has no wisdom modifier.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 15, so it takes the damage! Go ahead and roll.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: If the target is missing any of its hit points, it instead takes 1d12 necrotic damage.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You're level five, so it technically--

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: (Jester voice) Technically!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It's a 5th-level character, so it's--

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: All right. That's 17 points of necrotic damage.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Not bad for a cantrip!

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Boom!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "It's not too bad." All right, that's going to finish Jester's turn. Does she want to move?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I think she's going to back up again.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Back into the door? You got it. Jester is just on the side there. All right, finishes Jester's go, Yasha you're up.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Okay, I am going to attack with my--

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: At the top of your turn, you take blade damage because you're in proximity to it. That's ten. You take ten points of piercing damage. So, reduced to five.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: You're a beast. You're great.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: All right, so, question? I would like to try to use the Dispel Magic portion of my Magician's Judge.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Now?

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: I don't know; is that bad?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I don't know, can you get in there? Is the guts exposed?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Is there enough gut to hit?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: There are a couple of pockets where you can see inside of it, but you don't see the power source. It's risky.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Okay, I'm going to wait.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: So you're just taking a strike with it? You have advantage because you're flanked with Beau.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I think that's the best thing I've done this whole fight, is flanking.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Some fights aren't great for every class, I'm sorry.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 19 hits! Roll damage.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: 16 to hit, so that's not bad.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yep, 16 AC.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Okay. 17 points.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 17 points! Carving past with the blade. You have a second strike, if you'd like.
